intro: Jamesbrittenia montana, commonly known as the mountain Jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, high-altitude environments.
